messages: 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:26): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, okay, so forget about performance.  I'm trying to debug an uncaught exception in testharness.js, and it's at the end of a stack of 20 recursive calls to render, substitute, substitute_single, substitute_children, and map.  Where render is called originally by Output.show_results.  If we just built the HTML directly, this problem would probably be trivial to debug if it occurred at all.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:26): This is really not a good level of abstraction.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:27): anyone know how i can find out what punctuation sorts below '"' in the en-US.utf8 locale on my linux box?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:28): If you're worried about safety, I'd take the slight extra length of direct use of DOM methods over this templating stuff anyday.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:28): writes a patch to see how long that would be
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:43): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, http://pastebin.com/mDEs9T4j
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:43): And completely safe, innerHTML used only for static strings.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:44): Oh, wait, I was using the wrong brace style, so really it should be -7 lines.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:44): If you ignore lines that are blank or contain only brackets/braces/etc., still -3 lines.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:44): Would you object if I commit this?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:45): (BTW, it also fixed the mysterious deeply-nested exception I was getting with the templating stuff)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:57): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: Yes, that is the worst problem
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:58): When there is an error and the stack trace is, uh, confusing
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:58): And the advantage is . . . ?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:00): I mean, I can see how in theory you might want it to be shorter, but it's actually not.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:00): At least in this case.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:00): Well it seems like a nice model. Nice enough that annevk is pushing something not dissimilar for DOM :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:00): In what way is it nice?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:00): But I won't object to this patch
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:01): It is a very regular way of describing the tree that you want just using js objects
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:01): pushes the patch
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:02): Rather than having to use special code for each different case
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:06): That might be useful in some theoretical circumstances, just not here.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:26): strongly suspects that assert_*() is a bottleneck here too
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:26): It seems to format the message even if it's not going to be used, which hopefully it rarely will be.
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (00:30): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: heya
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (00:33): I didn't understand your question‚Ä¶

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:35): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, I'm going to be pushing some microoptimizations to testharness.js that provide large quantifiable performance gains on large result sets.  I just pushed the first one.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (00:35): I've had an idea for something like this d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 http://www.diveinto.org/html5/modern.index.html
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:35): I'll ask you first if they involve any substantial refactoring or design changes.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (00:35): but it's fully based on the themework you did for the developers whatwg
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (00:36): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: it looks gnarly
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (00:36): cool
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (00:36): thanks
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (00:36): I never licensed it or anything‚Ä¶ mainly just didn't consider other uses for it
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (00:37): It's a good outline for any collection of papers on a subject.
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (00:37): design, I mean
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (00:37): I'm just experimenting with fonts to find something that will read comfortably on my iPad as well.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:39): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I think the commit message was harsh even if I don't entirely disagree
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:39): (for the template removal)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:39): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, sorry about that.
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (00:40): 70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132: if anything is worth putting back into developers.whatwg.org, let me know :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:40): I was a little frustrated after having to deal with a few too many giant stack traces and a little too much bad performance.  :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:40): is working on the latter right now
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (00:41): d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40: i'll definitely let you know if it is.

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:51): d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40: i was wondering how often the developers.whatwg.org site was resynced and whether it would make sense for me to only update the source file once a week or something
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (00:53): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Are you doing that manually?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:54): it's in a script that triggers each time i update, currently
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (00:54): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I just run it manually still‚Ä¶ I always meant to make it a cron task
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (00:55): I run it every few weeks
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:00): d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40: let me know if you ever run it more often than once a week :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:01): d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40: i'll make my script not bother unless it's more than a week old
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:01): saves me some CPU
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (01:01): sure thing
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (01:02): just re-deployed it now :)
